description: Shared with quisquis and quiscoskos; from Latin quisquis (“whosoever”) or by reduplication of Latin quis (“of what kind”).

adjectives.description: quisquous (comparative more quisquous, superlative most quisquous)

entries.meaning: (Scotland, rare) Hard to deal with; dubious; of people: having a character difficult to assess.
examples: Synonyms: mysterious, perplexing, puzzling, dubious, doubtful, debatable, quisquis, quiscoskos
